Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] Applied Flight Mechanics and Flight Controls

Messages.Author: Sutej Singh
Messages.Content: Dear Students,  as we talked about on Thursday we will be going to the airfield on Monday. We are going to meet at 9am in front of the ILR Building and prepare everything for the flight tests. Unfortunately we do not have a van to transport everyone to the airfield so we will come up with a plan on monday morning on how it would be best for everyone to get to the field.  Please remember to bring the following to the airfield:  Water Food Sunscreen A hat  Sunglasses  Your laptops I hope you guys have a nice weekend and see you all on monday morning.  Sutej

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Thesis at the department of Flight Mechanics, Flight Control and Aeroelasticity

Messages.Author: Sutej Singh
Messages.Content: Dear students, The Chair for flight mechanics, flight control, and aeroelasticity would like to take the start of the new semester as an opportunity to inform interested students, who are currently looking for a thesis topic, about possible theses at our department. Therefore, we are offering the following event:  Information event for final theses at the Department of Flight Mechanics, Flight Control & Aeroelasticity Monday, 22.04.2024 12 - 14 o'clock F224 This event is in person. The research assistants will briefly present each topic on offer. Afterward, you will have the chance to talk to the potential supervisors in person and ask questions or get suggestions. If you have any questions by then, please feel free to contact Hannes Wilke (h.wilke[at]tu-berlin.de).

Messages.Author: Sutej Singh
Messages.Content: Dear Students,  I wanted to inform all of you that the AFF course is limited to 16 participants. Therefore, the first appointment is mandatory (Thursday 18.04 at 2pm). If you're unable to attend the first appointment but would like to take part in the course, please send us an E-Mail confirming this.  A nice start into the new summer semester 2024 All the best
